Research Papers on AI Systems, Audio Detection, and Large Language Models
Aaron Hurst et al. published GPT-4o System Card in arXiv preprint in 2024.
Xiang Li et al. published SONAR: A Synthetic AI-Audio Detection Framework and Benchmark in arXiv preprint in 2024.
Vipula Rawte et al. published a survey of hallucination in large foundation models in arXiv preprint in 2023.
Robin San Roman et al. published Latent Watermarking of Audio Generative Models in arXiv preprint in 2024.
Forrest McKee and David Noever published research on safeguarding voice privacy using near-ultrasonic interference in 2024.
Yi Xie et al. published research on enabling fast and universal audio adversarial attack using generative model in 2021.
Xinyue Shen et al. published Voice Jailbreak Attacks Against GPT-4o in arXiv preprint in 2024.
Mintong Kang et al. published AdvWave: Stealthy Adversarial Jailbreak Attack against Large Audio-Language Models in arXiv preprint in 2024.
Rui Zhang et al. published research on user authentication based on personal voice challenges in 2022.
Lei Wang et al. published a survey on large language model based autonomous agents in 2024.
Jiayi Pan et al. published research on Autonomous Evaluation and Refinement of Digital Agents in 2024.
Soroush Nasiriany et al. published Pivot: Iterative visual prompting elicits actionable knowledge for VLMs in arXiv preprint in 2024.
Ruisheng Cao et al. published Spider2-V research on multimodal agents in arXiv preprint in 2024.
Yijia Shao et al. published research on assisting in writing Wikipedia-like articles with large language models in 2024.
Boyuan Zheng et al. published research suggesting GPT-4V is a generalist web agent in 2024.
